title: Do cell towers keep track of mobile phones while phones are turned on, sitting idle, and in one place for an extended period? How often do they communicate under this circumstance? - Quora

response.answer_text: The towers do not track the phones. The central network control and billing system does. Each mobile phone sends out a ping message. The towers detect the ping and the network node assigns the phone to a specific zone based on free resources and signal strength. As you move around the pings are detected by different towers and the system will slowly move you around a network
